P.content: Kant came closest to infinite reconciliation in Critique (reconciling infinite gulf opened in 1st & 2nd critique) > Hegel could reflect & reappropriate the Critique “almost at once,” but still a lack, in form of representative anticipation, reconciliation announced as duty, Sollen to infinity
P.linkedContent: Kant came closest to infinite reconciliation in Critique (reconciling infinite gulf opened in 1st & 2nd critique) > Hegel could reflect & reappropriate the Critique “almost at once,” but still a lack, in form of representative anticipation, reconciliation announced as duty, Sollen to infinity

P.content: Heidegger defends Critique of Judgment’s meditation on art against Nietzsche’s reading
P.linkedContent: Heidegger defends Critique of Judgment’s meditation on art against Nietzsche’s reading

P.content: difficulty, for Kant, to think judgment: what is the a priori of a middle term? regulative principles would not allow for a proper domain, judgment as place deprived of place, neither practical nor theoretical
P.linkedContent: difficulty, for Kant, to think judgment: what is the a priori of a middle term? regulative principles would not allow for a proper domain, judgment as place deprived of place, neither practical nor theoretical

P.content: judgment (Urteil) as Mittelglied (middle articulation) btwn understanding/reason; is this third faculty [party?] attached to the other two, a part on its own? Kant can’t decide

P.content: if one can find a priori principles only in understanding, “great difficulties” in finding a priori of faculty of judgment w/out risking empiricism, but it must give itself its own norms

P.content: aesthetic judgments not one example but the example of judgment

P.content: the lacunary character (Mangelhaftigkeit) [Hegel] of Kant’s Critique of Judgment, its lack as its frame, lack of theory of frame, or lack in theory of frame [Kant blames nature, old age]

P.content: Critique of Judgment about pleasure, being-pleasure of pleasure, possibility of pleasure, thus begin w/ taste, w/ affect not object, judgment of taste is subjective—outside of knowledge
P.linkedContent: Critique of Judgment about pleasure, being-pleasure of pleasure, possibility of pleasure, thus begin w/ taste, w/ affect not object, judgment of taste is subjective—outside of knowledge

P.content: “grosse Schwierigkeit” of critical judgment of beauty [un plaisir désintéressé], auto-affection must cathect w/ pure objectivity, universality w/out concept, pure pleasure w/out enjoyment > Wohlgefallen (I-please-myself-in), Je-me-plais-à-me-plaire-à > auto-affection immediately goes outside: is pure hetero-affection, tout autre cathects me, w/out which, there’d be no universality

P.content: Kant’s intro (the foundation) came after he wrote Critique, tries to articulate critique w/ philosophy, Kant’s critique not metaphysics, it’s a crane (une grue) or dragline bucket (une drague) above the pit (la fosse), travaillant à gratter, fouiller, déblayer, looking to open up sure ground [compare to reading machine in Glas]
P.linkedContent: Kant’s intro (the foundation) came after he wrote Critique, tries to articulate critique w/ philosophy, Kant’s critique not metaphysics, it’s a crane (une grue) or dragline bucket (une drague) above the pit (la fosse), travaillant à gratter, fouiller, déblayer, looking to open up sure ground [compare to reading machine in Glas]

P.content: in what order do we read the critique: the de facto order, the de jure?
P.linkedContent: in what order do we read the critique: the de facto order, the de jure?

P.content: divide btwn reflective/determinant judgment watches over internal divisions of Critique: 1) reflective (art): example first, particular allows discovery of law 2) determinant (science, logic): law first, specifies, narrows, tightens around particular
P.linkedContent: divide btwn reflective/determinant judgment watches over internal divisions of Critique: 1) reflective (art): example first, particular allows discovery of law 2) determinant (science, logic): law first, specifies, narrows, tightens around particular

P.content: where is the heart of the Critique?—[can only latch onto hinges (brisures), to parergons] > is Derrida taking unfair advantage of subchapters, but what is the proper text?
P.linkedContent: where is the heart of the Critique?—[can only latch onto hinges (brisures), to parergons] > is Derrida taking unfair advantage of subchapters, but what is the proper text?

P.content: fundamental presupposition in Critique: aesthetic judgment must bear upon intrinsic beauty, know difference btwn extrinsic/intrinsic
P.linkedContent: fundamental presupposition in Critique: aesthetic judgment must bear upon intrinsic beauty, know difference btwn extrinsic/intrinsic

P.content: Kant’s table of 12 categories [of knowledge/understanding] is repeated for judgment—which is mediate knowledge of object (but it offers no knowledge…)

P.content: Kant imports logical frame into nonlogical structure > the frame fits badly, violence of frame multiplies: theory of aesthetic in theory of beautiful in theory of taste in theory of judgment

P.content: Derrida reads footnotes, parentheses, hastily imported frames (re: Kant’s discrete admittance that there’s something of understanding in judgment) as invagination (pocket in “main” text) [Kant forced things, not Derrida?]

P.content: for Kant, beauty is universality w/out concept—necessitates an analogy, occupation of nonconceptual field by the grid (quadrillage) of conceptual force: sans et avec [concept] en même temps (ama)

P.content: Kant’s pushing along his theory w/ aid of highchair, wheelchair, things aren’t going well
P.linkedContent: Kant’s pushing along his theory w/ aid of highchair, wheelchair, things aren’t going well

P.content: but en blanc [cf. C p. 229 can(n)on] (gun as finality w/out end in sight) [goal as white page] Kant’s finality w/out end: free beauty, wild tulip

P.content: paradox of 3rd Critique: singularities must give rise to universalizable judgments > Kant’s free beauty: self-subsisting, always beautiful once
P.linkedContent: paradox of 3rd Critique: singularities must give rise to universalizable judgments > Kant’s free beauty: self-subsisting, always beautiful once

P.content: the strange fact that the median propositions (those on free beauty) in Kant’s Critique remain suspended, lack immediate justification—though magnetized by their end
P.linkedContent: the strange fact that the median propositions (those on free beauty) in Kant’s Critique remain suspended, lack immediate justification—though magnetized by their end

P.content: [the paradox of the Critique] is there idea/ideal, adequation & mimesis in beauty? ideal beauty is adherent, not free beauty, only ideal of imagination/presentation (Darstellung); man, endowed w/ reason, only being capable of a sans (of ideal of beauty), of giving himself his own ends; he is not errant, cannot conceive himself w/out goal, but he can put errancy, sans, into perspective; in this way man can never be aestheticized, cannot be beautiful, this is the “Copernican Revolution”? (sans of pure cut is effaced in him)
P.linkedContent: [the paradox of the Critique] is there idea/ideal, adequation & mimesis in beauty? ideal beauty is adherent, not free beauty, only ideal of imagination/presentation (Darstellung); man, endowed w/ reason, only being capable of a sans (of ideal of beauty), of giving himself his own ends; he is not errant, cannot conceive himself w/out goal, but he can put errancy, sans, into perspective; in this way man can never be aestheticized, cannot be beautiful, this is the “Copernican Revolution”? (sans of pure cut is effaced in him)

E.content: Kant allies pure morality w/ empirical culturalism in critique of pure judgments of taste
E.linkedContent: Kant allies pure morality w/ empirical culturalism in critique of pure judgments of taste

E.content: a politics (a political economy) acts upon his discourse

EU.content: every critique of censorship is a critique of judgment, censorship is a judgment, proposes laws, tribunal, code > censere, to evaluate (réputer), compute, count—ratio, “census,” “cens,” is enumeration of citizens
EU.linkedContent: every critique of censorship is a critique of judgment, censorship is a judgment, proposes laws, tribunal, code > censere, to evaluate (réputer), compute, count—ratio, “census,” “cens,” is enumeration of citizens

EU.content: Kant’s architectonics (of Reason) as internal principle, organic whole or organic purposiveness (finalité), one sets out from a purpose (on part de la fin), as in every organic totality > organic “metaphor” in Critique of Pure Reason presages the 3rd Critique
EU.linkedContent: Kant’s architectonics (of Reason) as internal principle, organic whole or organic purposiveness (finalité), one sets out from a purpose (on part de la fin), as in every organic totality > organic “metaphor” in Critique of Pure Reason presages the 3rd Critique

EU.content: if one does not set out from architectonic principle, one only achieves “technical” unity, “know-how”
EU.linkedContent: if one does not set out from architectonic principle, one only achieves “technical” unity, “know-how”

EU.content: Kant of Critique of Judgment takes himself beyond oppositions, tries to think the living & art
